darkvision.description: You can see in dim light within 60 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim.

dwarven-resilience.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance against poison damage.

dwarven-combat-training.description: You have proficiency with the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer.

dwarven-tool-proficiency.description: You gain proficiency with one of: smiths tools, brewers supplies, or masons tools.

stonecunning.description: When making an intelligence (History) check related to stonework, you are proficient and add double your proficiency bonus.

dwarven-toughness.description: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and again by 1 every time you gain a level.

dwarven-armor-training.description: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

keen-senses.description: You have proficiency in the perception skill.

fey-ancestry.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

trance.description: You can meditate for four hours to gain the rest a human gains for 8 hours of sleep.

elf-weapon-training.description: You gain proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

elf-cantrip.description: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting stat for it.

extra-language.description: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choice.

mask-of-the-wild.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

superior-darkvision.description: You can see in dim light within 120 feet as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim.

sunlight-sensitivity.description: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks that rely on sight when you, your target, or what you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight

drow-magic.description: You know the dancing lights cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the faerie fire spell once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can cast darkness once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

drow-weapon-training.description: You have proficiency with rapiers, shortswords, and hand crossbows

lucky.description: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

brave.description: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

halfling-nimbleness.description: You can move through the space of any creature that is a size larger than yours.

naturally-stealthy.description: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you

stout-resilience.description: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance against poison damage.

variant-human.description: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice, and gain one feat of your choice.

draconic-ancestry.description: You have draconic ancestry. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are based on your chosen dragon type.

draconic-breath-weapon.description: Your ancestry determines the shape and damage type. Targets must make a saving throw (based on your ancestry) with DC 8 + your constitution modifier + your prof. bonus, and takes 2d6 damage, or half as much on a successful save. Damage increases to 3d6 at 6th level, 4d6 at 11th, and 5d6 at 16th. Recharges after a short or long rest.

draconic-damage-resistance.description: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

gnome-cunning.description: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

natural-illusionist.description: You know the minor illusion cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

speak-with-small-beasts.description: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animaIs and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

artificiers-lore.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of the bonus you would normally apply.

tinker.description: You have proficiency with tinkers tools, and with them can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a tiny clockwork device.

skill-versatility.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

menacing.description: You gain proficiency in the intimidation skill.

relentless-endurance.description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

savage-attacks.description: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

hellish-resistance.description: You have resistance to fire damage.

infernal-legacy.description: You know the thaumaturgy cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hellish rebuke spell once per day as a 2nd-level spell. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the darkness spell once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spclls

rage.description: You can enter a rage as a bonus action, allowing you advantage on strength checks and saving throws, extra damage, and resistance to damage. See the Players Handbook for complete rules.

barbarian-unarmored-defense.description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

monk-unarmored-defense.description: While you are wearing no armor and not using a shield, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

bardic-spellcasting.description: You have learned to untangle and reshape the fabric of reality in harmony with your wishes and music. See the Players Handbook for full rules on Bardic Spellcasting.

bardic-inspiration.description: You can inspire others within 60 feet through stirring words or music. They gain a d6. Once, within 10 minutes, they can roll the die and add the number to an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. A creature can only have on bardic inpiration die at a time.

cleric-spellcasting.description: As a conduit for divine power,k you can cast cleric spells. See the Players Handbook for full rules on Cleric Spellcasting.

divine-domain.description: Your choice of a domain associated with your deity grants you domain spells and other features.

druidic.description: You know druidic, the secret language of druids.

druidic-spellcasting.description: Drawing on the divine essence of nature itself, you can cast spells to shape that essence to your will. See the Players Handbook for full rules on Druid Spellcasting.

fighting-style.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, chosen from Archery, Defense, Dueling, Great Weapon Fighting, Protection, or Two-Weapon Fighting.

second-wind.description: On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level. You must finish a short or long rest to use this ability again.

martial-arts.description: You gain extra benefits when using unarmed strikes or monk weapons, such as extra attacks or the use of dexterity instead of strength for attacks. See the Players Handbook for the full rules on Martial Arts.

divine-sense.description: You can use your divine sense to detect celestials, fiends, or undead, or whether a place or object has been consecrated or desecrated. See Players Handbook for full rules.

lay-on-hands.description: You have a pool of healing points equal to your paladin level times 5, which you can use to heal creatures you touch as an action. See the Players Handbook for the full rules.

favoured-enemy.description: You can choose a type of favored enemy. You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your favored enemy, as well as on intelligence checks to recall information about them. You also learn one language of your choice that is spoken by your favored enemies, if they speak one.

natural-explorer.description: You can choose a type of natural environment you are adept at traveling and surviving in. You gain various advantages in these kinds of terrains. See the Players Handbook for full rules.

expertise.description: Choose two skill proficiencies (or proficiency with theives tools and a skill proficiency.) Your proficiency bonus is doubled for these ability checks.

thieves-cant.description: You know thieves cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation.

sneak-attack.description: Once per turn, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to a creature you hit with advantage on the attack roll. You must use a finesse or ranged weapon. You don't need advantage on the attack if an ally is within 5 feet of the target and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll. The extra damage increases as you level, per the Sneak Attack column of the Rouge table.

sorcerous-spellcasting.description: You are infused with arcane magic. See the Players Handbook for full rules on Sorcerer Spellcasting.

sorcerous-origin.description: You must choose a sorcerous origin, which describes the source of your innate magical power: Draconic Bloodline, or Wild Magic.

otherworldy-patron.description: You have struct a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice: the Archfey, the Fiend, or the Great Old One. Your choice grants you special features.

pact-magic.description: Your arcane research and the magic bestowed on you by your patron have given you facility with spells. See the Players Handbook for full rules on Pact Magic.

wizard-spellcasting.description: As a student of arcane magic, you have a spellbook containing spells that show the first glimmerings of your true power. See the Players Handbooks for full rules on Wizard Spellcasting.

arcane-recovery.description: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose to recover expended spell slots that have a combined level less than or equal to half your wizard level, rounded up. None of the slots can be 6th level or higher.
